generation

Class Floorplan

  • java.lang.Object
    • generation.Floorplan

  • public class Floorplan
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the floorplan of a maze. It describes a rectangular shape of squares or quadratic cells with a 2 dimensional grid and it encapsulates access to each cell in that grid. The internal two-dimensional array matches with a grid of cells as follows: floorplan[0,y] form the left border, hence there is a wallboard on left. floorplan[width-1,y] form the right border, hence there is a wallboard on right. floorplan[x,0] form the top border, hence there is a wallboard on top. floorplan[x,height-1] form the bottom border, hence there is a wallboard on bottom. The upper left corner is seen as position [0][0]. Warning: MapDrawer locates (0,0) at the bottom-left corner on the screen when it draws the map. Each cell has a location (x,y) on the grid. It stores information for each direction whether there is a wallboard installed on that side and if so whether that wallboard needs to stay like a load bearing wall. The exterior walls of the maze and the exterior walls of rooms inside the maze are "load bearing" and need to stay in place. This is captured with a notion of a border. A border is not removed by the maze generation procedure. It is used to mark the outside border of the maze as well as those wallboards of internal rooms that should remain in place. One can think of the border attribute as a little sticker on a wallboard that says "leave this wallboard in place". Wallboards can be taken down by the maze generation procedure otherwise. Note that for a calculated maze, at least one cell on the border will have a missing wallboard for an exit somewhere. The internal encoding of this information into a single integer for each cell is performed with bit operations (&,|) to set individual bits in a 4 byte/32 bit integer and thus error prone. The encapsulation within this class localizes all bit operations for this encoding. This code is refactored code from Maze.java by Paul Falstad, www.falstad.com, Copyright (C) 1998, all rights reserved Paul Falstad granted permission to modify and use code for teaching purposes. The class resulted from refactoring the int[][] cells area in the original Maze and Mazebuilder classes into a class of its own. Refactored by Peter Kemper

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initialize floorplan such that all cells have not been visited, all wallboards inside the maze are up, and borders form a rectangle on the outside of the maze. It is fully enclosed, there is no exit.

        public int hashCode()

                          int y)
        Get the value of a cell at the given position (x,y).

      • canTearDown

        public boolean canTearDown(Wallboard wallboard)
        checks if cell (x,y) and adjacent neighbor in the given direction are not separated by a border and the neighbor has not been visited before.
        Parameters:
        wallboard - provides (x,y) coordinates for cell and the direction precondition borders limit the outside of the maze area precondition 0 <= x < width, 0 <= y < height
        Returns:
        true if neighbor in the given direction is new and wallboard can be taken down, false otherwise

      • isPartOfBorder

        public boolean isPartOfBorder(Wallboard wallboard)
        checks if the given wallboard contributes to a border. One can think of exterior walls of the maze and its rooms as essential for the structure and their wallboards should not be removed, like a load-bearing wall.

                          int y,

                          int dy)
        checks if cell (x,y) has a border in the given direction (dx,dy)
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of cell
        y - coordinate of cell
        dx - direction towards side
        dy - direction towards side precondition 0 <= x < width, 0 <= y < height precondition dx, dy in {-1,0,1}
        Returns:
        true if that side is marked as a border, false otherwise

      • setExitPosition

        public void setExitPosition(int x,
                            int y)
        Establish exit position by breaking down wallboard to outside area. If (x,y) is not located next to an outside wallboard, the method no effect.
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of cell, 0 <= x < width
        y - coordinate of cell, 0 <= y < height

        y - coordinate of cell, 0 <= y < height
        Returns:

      • isInRoom

        public boolean isInRoom(int x,
                        int y)

        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of cell, 0 <= x < width
        y - coordinate of cell, 0 <= y < height
        Returns:

      • areaOverlapsWithRoom

        public boolean areaOverlapsWithRoom(int rx,
                                    int ry,
                                    int rxl,
                                    int ryl)
        Checks if there is a cell in the given area that belongs to a room. The first corner (rx,ry) is at the upper left position, the second corner (rxl,ryl) is at the lower right position. Precondition 0 <= rx <= rxl < width, 0 <= ry <= ryl < height
        Parameters:
        rx - 1st corner, x coordinate
        ry - 1st corner, y coordinate
        rxl - 2nd corner, x coordinate
        ryl - 2nd corner, y coordinate
        Returns:
        true if area contains a cell that is already in a room or if it is too close to the border, false otherwise

      • markAreaAsRoom

        public void markAreaAsRoom(int rw,
                           int rh,
                           int rx,
                           int ry,
                           int rxl,
                           int ryl)
        Marks a given area as a room on the maze and positions up to five doors randomly. The first corner is at the upper left position, the second corner is at the lower right position. Assumes that given area is located on the map and does not intersect with any existing room. The wallboards of a room are declared as borders to prevent the generation mechanism from tearing them down. Of course there must be a few walls where doors can be created so the border protection is removed for .
        Parameters:
        rw - room width
        rh - room height
        rx - 1st corner, x coordinate
        ry - 1st corner, y coordinate
        rxl - 2nd corner, x coordinate
        ryl - 2nd corner, y coordinate

      • encloseArea

        private void encloseArea(int rx,
                         int ry,
                         int rxl,
                         int ryl)
        Erects wallboards marked as borders on the perimeter of an internal area to fully enclose area. Wallboards marked as borders are added from both directions so this method only applies to areas where adjacent outside neighboring cells are still inside the maze floorplan. Rectangular area represent by upper left corner (rx,ry) and lower right corner (rxl,ryl).
        Parameters:
        rx - x-coordinate of upper left corner
        ry - y-coordinate of upper left corner
        rxl - x-coordinate of lower right corner
        ryl - y-coordinate of lower right corner

      • setWallToZero

        private void setWallToZero(int x,
                           int y,
                           int dx,
                           int dy)
        Sets the wallboard bit to zero for a given cell and direction
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of cell, 0 <= x < width
        y - coordinate of cell, 0 <= y < height
        dx - direction x, in } obtained from dirsx[]
        dy - direction y, in } obtained from dirsy[] precondition 0 <= x < width, 0 <= y < height

                          int y,

                          int dy)

        y - coordinate of cell, 0 <= y < height

        dy - direction y, in { -1, 0, 1} obtained from dirsy[]

                                int y,
                                int dx,

        y - coordinate of cell, 0 <= y < height

        dy - direction y, in { -1, 0, 1} obtained from dirsy[]

      • addWallboard

        public void addWallboard(Wallboard wallboard,
                         boolean internalWall)
        Add a wallboard. If internal it is added on both sides between to adjacent cells (x,y) and (x+dx,y+dy).
        Parameters:
        wallboard - gives the wallboard to add
        internalWall - denotes if wallboard is added on both cells (true) or just for the given cell (false)

      • deleteWallboard

        public void deleteWallboard(Wallboard wallboard)
        Delete both wallboards between to adjacent cells (x,y) and (x+dx,y+dy) to create an opening. Deleting the wallboard at (x,y) implies that also a wallboard in opposite direction at (x+dx,y+dy) gets deleted. Do not use this method to create an exit as the adjacent location is outside of the legal range of values for cell locations.
        Parameters:
        wallboard - provides (x,y) coordinate of cell and direction

      • addWall

        public void addWall(Wall seg,
                    int map_unit)
        Add wallboards in either north or west direction for the given wall. Wall coordinates need to be rescaled by map_unit to translate into cell coordinates. Method is only used to track seen cells in the FirstPersonDrawer for the MapDrawer. So achieved properties for cells object differ than for other methods used to represent the maze.
        Parameters:
        seg - gives the wall whose wallboards need to be added
        map_unit - gives the scaling factor to obtain the cell coordinates

      • hasWall

        public boolean hasWall(int x,
                       int y,
                       CardinalDirection dir)
        Tells if the given position has a wallboard in the given direction. This is true after cells.initialize() and before deleting this wallboard. A wallboard can be deleted by directly calling deleteWall() or by removing all wallboards within a room, method markAreaAsRoom().
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of cell, 0 <= x < width
        y - coordinate of cell, 0 <= y < height
        dir - gives the cardinal direction
        Returns:
        true if (x,y) position has wallboard in the given direction

      • hasNoWall

        public boolean hasNoWall(int x,
                         int y,
                         CardinalDirection dir)
        Tells if the given position has no wallboard in the given direction. This is true after cells.initialize() and before deleting this wallboard. A wallboard can be deleted by directly calling deleteWall() or by removing all wallboards within a room, method markAreaAsRoom().
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of cell, 0 <= x < width
        y - coordinate of cell, 0 <= y < height
        dir - gives the cardinal direction
        Returns:
        true if (x,y) position has no wallboard in the given direction

      • getCWConstantForDirection

        protected int getCWConstantForDirection(CardinalDirection dir)
        Gives the matching bit encoded value, the matching CW_TOP, BOT, LEFT, RIGHT constants in Constants.java for the given direction. TOP is matched with North, Right is matched with East
        Parameters:
        dir - gives the direction.
        Returns:
        the matching integer value (CW_ constant)

      • logWall

        private void logWall(int x,
                     int y,
                     int dx,
                     int dy)
        Append wallboard information to logging data. Currently used to log the sequence of wallboards that are deleted in the maze generation phase
        Parameters:
        x - current position, x coordinate
        y - current position, y coordinate
        dx - direction, x coordinate, -1 <= dx <= 1
        dy - direction, y coordinate, -1 <= dy <= 1
